ProcedureHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROC OPTIONS <option(s)>;
  
The OPTIONS procedure lists the current settings of SAS system options in the SAS log. 

SAS system options control how SAS formats output, handles files, processes data sets, 
'interacts with the operating environment, and does other tasks that are not specific 
to a single SAS program or data set. You can change the settings of SAS system options 
by using one of the following methods:

  o the SAS command 
  o the option in a configuration or autoexec file 
  o the SAS OPTIONS statement 
  o the OPTLOAD and OPTSAVE procedures 
  o the SAS System Options window 
  o the DMOPTSAVE and DMOPTLOAD commands 
  o in other ways, depending on your operating environment.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
Displays the short description of the option, the option group, and the option type.
      
Beginning in SAS 9.3, valid values for an option now display in the SAS log when you specify the DEFINE option.
Displays the path using the value of the environment variable.
Displays the path using the environment variable.

Syntax: GROUP=group-name 
        GROUP=(group-name-1 ... group-name-n)
      
Displays the options in one or more groups specified by group-name.
Displays system option character values as hexadecimal values.

Lists the system option groups for all operating environments and a description 
of each group.
Lists each option on a separate line with a description.
Produces a compressed listing without the descriptions.
Displays numeric system option values using commas.
Displays numeric system option values without using commas.

[Syntax: OPTION=option-name(s)] 
      
Displays a short description and the value (if any) of the option specified 
by option-name.

Beginning in SAS 9.3,The OPTION= option now accepts one or more options.

Displays the system options that have been set by your site administrator in a 
restricted options configuration file.

Displays the option value and scope, as well as how the value was set. 
      
Beginning in SAS 9.3, if the option was set by a configuration file, the name of the 
configuration file that set the option now displays in the SAS log when you specify 
the VALUE option.

Lists the system options whose value can be modified by the INSERT and APPEND system options. 
      
The INSERT option specifies a value that is inserted as the first value of a system 
option value list. The APPEND option specifies a value that is appended as the last 
value of a system option value list. Use the LISTINERTAPPEND option to display which 
system options can have values inserted at the beginning or appended at the end of 
their value lists.
Lists the system options that can be restricted by your site administrator.
Lists the system options that can be saved with PROC OPTSAVE or the DMOPTSAVE command.
